## Data Loading

```{python}
import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
path = "/home/fabri/Projects/data-visualization-gallery/resources/natality.csv"
data = pd.read_csv(path)

print(data.head())
```

## Building de graph

```{python}
# Overall distribution
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 5))
sns.scatterplot(data=data, x="annual_income_k", y="child_spending_k", hue="education_level")
plt.title("People who earn more spend more in their childs?", fontsize=14, fontweight='bold')
plt.xlabel("Anual Income(k)")
plt.ylabel("Child Spending (k)")
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()
```
